thread.title: Bhavan’s, Dinanath, St John’s, VTC, Tidke in VHA Inter-School Hockey quarterfinals
thread.title_full: Bhavan’s, Dinanath, St John’s, VTC, Tidke in VHA Inter-School Hockey quarterfinals - The Times of India

author: Suhas Nayse
title: Bhavan’s, Dinanath, St John’s, VTC, Tidke in VHA Inter-School Hockey quarterfinals
text:
NAGPUR: Bhavan's BP Vidya Mandir, Ashti and Dinanath High School from Pool A became the first two teams to book quarterfinal berths in the VHA Inter-School Hockey tournament at the VHA ground here on Saturday. 

St John's High School from Pool C and Vimaltai Tidke Convent from Pool D, too, made it to the last eight with two wins under their belt. 

Bhavan's, Ashti rode on the solitary goal from Himanshu Ingle to beat Swaminarayan 1-0 in a keenly contested game while it was a walk in the park for Dinanath High School as South Point School, Omkar Nagar once again failed to turn up for their match. 

Bhavan's and Dinanath will lock horns on October 12 to decide the topper from Pool A. The topper will play against second placed team from Pool C while the second placed from Pool A will meet topper of Pool C in the quarter-finals which will be played on October 13. 

From Pool C, St John's High School, too booked quarter-final spot after they defeated St Joseph's, Jaitala 3-1 for their second win of the tournament. They have only one league game left against a lowly Vinalaya School which is slated on October 12. Similarly, VTC thrashed St Francis de Sales 5-2 for their second win. VTC will take on St Anthony in their last league match on Monday. SFS will now have to beat St Michael's in their last league game on Sunday to secure a place in the last eight from Pool D. 

From Pool B, Tidke Vidyalaya also confirmed their quarter-final spot with two wins from two games. 

RESULTS 

Bhavan's BP Vidya Mandir, Ashti 1 (Himanshu Ingle 19th) bt Swaminarayan School. 

Vimaltai Tidke Convent 5 (Kaustubh Baradiya 8th, 14th, Piyush Admane 32nd, 38th, 50th) bt SFS 2 (Sandesh Megani 16th, Nihal Kanfade 24th) 2. 

Dinanath HS got walk over as South Point School, Omkar Nagar failed to turn up. 

Railway Janmandal 3 (Rehan Khan 21st, Mithiliesh Malviya 26th, Naizes Lorens 40th) bt Ramesh Chandak 0. 

St John's HS 3 (Altamas Khan 9th, 32nd, Abid Sheikh 31st) bt St Joseph's, Jaitala 1 (Aniruddha Nitnaware 14th). 

Girls: Ira International 4 (Varsha Tripathi 6th, 12th, Sachi Kamble 19th, Prerna Bodke 27th) bt Vinalaya School 0.
